  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one 55 metal drum of Magni Performance Covered Paint (UN1263) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 quart of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup thew release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023120133
item.description:
Report E-2023120133

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLA experienced a UN1866 ELAN-Cast P 300 S RTC Low Odor release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of material released to the entire trailer floor as well as a 30’ x 20’ area of the concrete lot below due to the trailer wall puncturing the tote. The puncture was patched with wood to stop the release and the material was transferred into a new tote for shipment on. The free-standing liquid material was collected with a drum vac into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. Floor dry was then deployed and worked into the impacted areas and then collected into a third 55-gallon metal drum. The punctured tote was patched with absorbent pads & chemical tape. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023120031
item.description:
Report E-2023120031

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-02
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, (1) box containing (2) 1-gallon bottles of Blue Whale Muriatic Acid (UN1789) became crushed as a result of inadequate preparation for transportation. During the off-loading process, the damaged, crushed product began leaking onto the concrete dock floor; a total amount of 1-gallon. A Contractor neutralized the release using Kolorsafe Liquid Acid Neutralizer before absorbing the liquid and containerizing the spill debris into the proper UN-rated shipping container (a vented 55-gallon fiber drum). Additionally, the pallet in which the load was shipped on was also cut-up and containerized for waste disposal. Lastly, the impacted box that the leaking bottles shipped in was neutralized and containerized for waste disposal. No storm drains, waterways, or soil were impacting by the release.

  • Description: On Nov 22nd a package was discovered during the PM sort where the outer package was open. The package was marked as UN1044 Fire Extinguishers, 2.2. After opening the package it was discovered that the fire extinguisher inside had discharged. It is unknown what caused the discharge. The shipper was contacted to retrieve the package.

item.title: Report E-2023120104
item.description:
Report E-2023120104

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 29, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN2966 released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the dock floor due to faulty packaging. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel utilized absorbent pads and Simple Green to wipe down the impacted dock floor and other pails of product. All spent absorbent pads, PPE, and any miscellaneous cleanup debris were placed into one (1) 5-gallon pail. The two (2) damaged pails were placed into one (1) 55-gallon steel drum and staged onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023120072
item.description:
Report E-2023120072

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 28, 2023, six (6) one-gallon pails of UN1993 were crushed in transit and released approximately 0.25-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel utilized hand tools to remediate the impacted site and re-palletized the non-damaged pails. The six (6) damaged pails and all UN1993-impacted debris were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for and staged onsite for facility disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 22, 2023, two (2) 3.5 liter cans of UN1866 were crushed in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the product boxes. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel placed the two (2) damaged cans of UN1866 into one (1) 5-gallon pail. The impacted boxes were placed into one (1) additional 5-gallon pail. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet next to an unload door. DescribePack: Upon inspection, one of the 2 bottles was dented on the side and appeared to have a small leak coming from under the cap. Both bottles still felt mostly full and did not leak more when turned upside down. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage did not appear to spread. Box was placed in a salvage drum and moved to Hazmat cage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found by itself under the conveyor belt on load side. Box was in the upright position but was wet on one side. DescribePack: Upon inspection, one of the four bottles had a lot of dry white crust on the outer surface. All four jugs appeared mostly full while 2 caps could be tightened with a small twist and 2 appeared very slightly less full than the others. No leakage occurred when bottles were turned over after the tightening of the caps. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading. Box was placed in a drum, then moved to Hazmat cage.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Loose Caps Led to the package leaking. A package handler noticed this. They then proceeded to notify the manager of their area, who then placed the package in a damaged hazmat tote. The package was taken to the damages area. DescribePack: Loose caps led to the package leaking. There was a loss of 2 quarts of the material. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was brought to the damaged hazmat area. This was done to separate the package and prevent damage occurring to other packages.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX BROUGHT TO HWPA, BAGGED AND PLACED IN A RED TOTE. DescribePack: BOX WAS SATURATED ON ONE SIDE AND BOTTOM, RIPPED AND CLOSURES WERE OPEN. INSIDE, BOTTLE WAS STAINED, CAP LOOSE AND SEAL LIFTED APPROXIMATLY 1/2 INCH. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: CAP WAS TIGHTENED AND BOTTLE PLACED IN A BLUE HAZMAT BAG. BAG WAS SEALED. ALL MATERIALS BAGGED AND SEALED IN A YELLOW STORAGE DRUM.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: HAZMAT ADMIN WAS CALLED TO UNLOAD AREA. BOX WAS BAGGED AND SITTING UNDER THE CHUTE. BOX WAS LOADED INTO A RED TOTE AND TAKEN TO THE HWPA. DescribePack: 1 OF 6 CANS WAS LEAKING. BOX ABSORBED THE LIQUID. CAP WAS MISALIGNED AND LEAKED WHEN TILTED. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: CAP COULD NOT BE REALIGNED. ABSORBENT PADS WERE FOLDED AND PLACED AROUND CAP. ABSORBENT PAD WAS TAPED INTO PLACE AND SEALED. CAN WAS PLACED INTO AN INDUSTRIAL ZIP LOCK BAG AND SEALED.

Plastic jug had a crack going down the side. Crack was in the seam of the plastic indicating a manufacturing defect. item.description:
Report X-2023110866

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came down chute wet near a load door. DescribePack: Upon inspection, packing paper was wet inside box. A strong smell was detected. Shipping label was faded. One cap could be tightened with a small twist and multiple rectangle cans were disfigured at the bottom. No active leakage was found and no can felt completely empty. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was set aside and wrapped in a bag. Leakage was not spreading. Box was placed in a salvage drum and moved to Hazmat processing area.

DescribePack: 3 bottles of Zep Acidic Toilet bowl cleaner were found inside of the box. 4 were indicated on label. Of the 3 bottles present, none were actively leaking but green stains were seen on the surface. Minor stains were also seen on the torn portion of the box. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was secured in a thick bag when found. No active leakage was observed.

I was then notified of the package being damaged. I brought the package to the damaged hazmat cage. DescribePack: One of the aluminum cans has been punctured on the bottom corner. This appears, to be the source of the damage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was segregated, from other packages to prevent damage from spreading.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Shipment 125-59612280 was tendered to British Airways in our Dallas Fort Worth cargo office located at 2370 WEST AIRFIELD DR STE 100 DFW AIRPORT TX 75261. During screening, staff identified several packages containing Dangerous Goods that had not been declared on the shipping papers. The shipment has been placed on hold pending an investigation with the shipper and this report has been filed.

  • Description: On 10/27/2023 at approximately 0830, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 393838 at the ramp facility in Fort Worth, reporting a package spill. The shipment consisted of 3 fiberboard boxes, each containing seat belt pretensioners. The shipment ending -6766 was found damaged, resulting in spillage. The package is being held for pick-up by the reciepient.
